abstract: Justice Dept concludes two-year review, denying requests from Ascap and BMI to update longstanding consent decrees, which many in music industry blame for declining royalties in streaming era; department also informs agencies they must adopt so-called 100 percent licensing, upending decades of industry practice.
lead_paragraph: Ascap and BMI, clearinghouses for royalties, say that modifying their consent decrees was urgently needed to adapt to the new world of online music.

headline.main: Justice Department Won’t Alter Music Industry Royalty Rules
headline.print_headline: Royalty Rules Remain, and U.S. Adds a Twist

snippet: Ascap and BMI, clearinghouses for royalties, say that modifying their consent decrees was urgently needed to adapt to the new world of online music....

keywords.value: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers
keywords.name: organizations
